title: Self-Explanation and Visualization-Based Language Learning Course for Flexible Professional Development

context.additional_context: Need to strengthen self-directed learning competencies in smartphone-based limited-technology environments.

learning_goals: Learners analyze language rules using self-explanation techniques to develop three or more strategies applicable to real-world contexts.

Using visualization tools like Mermaid.js or PlantUML, learners diagram three complex syntax structures (e.g., recursive functions, lambda expressions) in a given programming language (e.g., Java, Python) and receive feedback from ≥1 of 2 peer reviewers confirming clear explanation of conceptual relationships
Learners monitor their language acquisition process with over 80% accuracy using a self-assessment checklist.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
